coda.count 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • The logratio-normal-multinomial distribution

    logratio-normal-multinomial random sample

    rlrnm.Rd

    logratio-normal-multinomial random sample

    rlrnm(n = NULL, size, mu, sigma, B = NULL, probs = FALSE)

    Arguments

    n

    sample size. if ommited, the value is obtained as the length of vector size (in that case, all parameters should be called using their name).

    size

    vector to set the multinomial sampling size. vector is reused to have length equal parameter n

    mu

    logratio-normal-multinomial mu parameter

    sigma

    logratio-normal-multinomial mu parameter

    B

    basis in which the parameters are expressed with

    probs

    logical indicating whether multinomial probabilities should be returned

    Value

    logratio-normal-multinomial random sample

    Examples

    mu = c(0,1)
sigma = diag(2)
rlrnm(10, 1000, mu, sigma)
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#>  [1,]  221  683   96
#>  [2,]  209  601  190
#>  [3,]  532  294  174
#>  [4,]  407  577   16
#>  [5,]  240  587  173
#>  [6,]  585  398   17
#>  [7,]  361  626   13
#>  [8,]  244  735   21
#>  [9,]  190  299  511
#> [10,]  105  422  473
